CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 45 However , the PCE of the random terpolymers showed a the nonlinear compositional dependence from 2 to 6% in the order P3 ( 5.61% ) > P4 ( 5.26% ) > P2 ( 4.91% ) > P5 ( 3.02% ) > P6 ( 2.09% ) ; this was consistent with the observed trend of the J SC .

Let's think step by step.

1. PCE: Polymerization degree of conversion
2. random terpolymers: A type of polymer material
3. P3, P4, P2, P5, P6: Different types or batches of the random terpolymers with specific compositions.

So, the Material Name entities in the paragraph are:

1. random terpolymers
2. P3, P4, P5, P6 (different types or batches of the random terpolymers)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Material Name: random terpolymers

(Note: In this context, "P3, P4, P5, P6" can also be considered as different types or batches of the random terpolymers, but since the paragraph does not provide enough context to distinguish them as distinct material names, they are not explicitly included in the answer.)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 45 However , the PCE of the random terpolymers showed a the nonlinear compositional dependence from 2 to 6% in the order P3 ( 5.61% ) > P4 ( 5.26% ) > P2 ( 4.91% ) > P5 ( 3.02% ) > P6 ( 2.09% ) ; this was consistent with the observed trend of the J SC .

Let's think step by step.

1. PCE: Polymer Critical Extraction (or Polymer Content Extraction)
2. random terpolymers
3. P3, P4, P5, P6: Different types of terpolymers with specific percentages mentioned in the parentheses.
4. 2 to 6%: Range of composition percentage.
5. the order: Sequence or arrangement.
6. P3, P4, P5, P6: Repeated mention of the same entities.
7. 5.61%, 5.26%, 4.91%, 3.02%, 2.09%: Specific percentage values for each terpolymer.
8. this was consistent with: Agreement or correspondence.
9. the observed trend: Pattern or tendency.
10. J SC: Junction resistance-sheet resistance or Joint Sheet Conductance.

So, the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are: PCE, J SC.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. PCE: Polymer Critical Extraction or Polymer Content Extraction
2. J SC: Junction resistance-sheet resistance or Joint Sheet Conductance

These are the only entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to material properties.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Polymer Critical Extraction (PCE) |
| Junction resistance-sheet resistance (J SC) |

Paragraph: 45 However , the PCE of the random terpolymers showed a the nonlinear compositional dependence from 2 to 6% in the order P3 ( 5.61% ) > P4 ( 5.26% ) > P2 ( 4.91% ) > P5 ( 3.02% ) > P6 ( 2.09% ) ; this was consistent with the observed trend of the J SC .

Let's think step by step.

1. PCE: Polymerization Commonion Efficiency
2. 2% to 6%: Range of compositional values
3. P3, P4, P5, P6: Different types of random terpolymers
4. 5.61%, 5.26%, 4.91%, 3.02%, 2.09%: Specific values of PCE for each terpolymer (P3, P4, P5, P6) respectively.
